paragraph.heading:
Dendrobium sutepense Rolfe ex Downie, Bull. Misc. Inform. Kew 1925: 374
, 1925

subSubSection.paragraph:
Specimen examined:—
MANDALAY . Pyinoolwin District :
Hartwell s.n.
in Mamyo Bot. Gard. 31 ( K )
.
SHAN . Taunggyi District : fide
Aung et al. (2020: 82)
.
Distribution:— Central Myanmar and Thailand .

Dendrobium terminale C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.
f., Trans. Linn. Soc. London 30: 149, 1874. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish 33
( lectotype K, designated by Clayton 2017: 69 ; isolectotype: W-R 40385 )

Homotypic synonyms:
Callista terminalis
(C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.f.) Kuntze,
Revis. Gen . Pl
. 2: 655, 1891.
Aporum terminale
(C.S.P.Parish & Rchb.f.) M.A.Clem.,
Telopea
10: 297, 2003.

Specimens examined:—
SAGAING . Kale District : fide
Aung et al. (2020: 82)
. TENASSERIM.
5 Jun 1932
,
Kerr O1006
( AMES , K , P )
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : type
.
TANINTHARYI . Dawei District :
245 m
,
Sep 1961
,
Keenan et al. 5467
( E , K ). Also reported from
Mandalay Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 75)
, but we have not seen material from this area.
Distribution:— The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Vietnam , southwestern China and Peninsular Malaysia .

Dendrobium thyrsiflorum
B.S.Williams, Orch.
-Grow. Man ., ed. 4: 172, 1871. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District , cult.
Williams s.n.
( holotype : not located)

Homotypic synonym:
Callista thyrsiflora (B.S.Williams) M.A.Clem.
,
Telopea
10: 289, 2003.

Heterotypic synonyms: ?
Dendrobium schroederi B.S.Williams, Nursery Cat. (B.S.Williams)
1869 (Spring): 8, 1869.

Dendrobium schroederi Dombrain, Fl. Mag. (London)
9: t. 502, 1870.

Dendrobium densiflorum
Lindl. var. walkerianum Warner, Select Orch.
3: t. 21, 1878.
Dendrobium thyrsiflorum B.S.Williams var. walkerianum (Warner) H.J.Veitch, Man. Orch. Pl.
3: 80, 1888. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District , comm. & imp. s.n. ( holotype : not located).

Dendrobium galliceanum Linden
,
Lindenia
6: 5, 1890.

Specimens examined:—
KACHIN . Bhamo District : comm. & imp. s.n. ( K , W-R 6221 )
.
CHIN . Mindat District :
9 Aug 2008
,
Yasuda 060020
( MBK )
.
MANDALAY . Pyinoolwin District :
915 m
,
18 May 1915
,

( RAF )
, ident. uncertain [fragment];
Mandalay District :
Rimann s.n.
( W-R 6559 )
;
Myingyan District :
1 Apr 2006
,
Khin Myo Htwe 103
( MBK [s], TNS ), fide
Tanaka et al. (2015: 77)
.
SHAN . Hopang District :
1525 m
,
Apr 1938
,
Dickason & Ohn Tiu 9275
( AMES )
;
Taunggyi District : fide Moore (1895: 171) ; same loc.,
1525 m
,
May 1938
,
Dickason 7874
( AMES )
;
Kengtung District :
1280 m
,
25 May 1940
,
Dickason 9699
( AMES )
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : types . Also reported from
Putao District in Kachin State by Saw Lwin (2007: 255 & 256), but we have not seen material from this area.
Distribution:— The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China .

Notes:— This species was validly described by B.S.Williams in 1871. However, the earlier name
D. schroederi B.S.Williams
may be the correct epithet. The treatment of ‘schroederi’ is confusing in the literature; some authors insist it is a semi-alba form of
D. densiflorum .
The plant on the plate of
D. schroederi Dombrain
is likely from the same importation as Williams’ taxon and seems the same as what is now called
D. thyrsiflorum .

Dendrobium tortile Lindl., Gard. Chron . 1847: 797
, 1847. Type:— MYANMAR (‘Java’).
Tanintharyi Region : Myeik District ,
Lobb s.n.
( holotype : K-LINDL )

Homotypic synonym:
Callista tortilis (Lindl.) Kuntze, Revis.
Gen . Pl.
2: 655, 1891.

Heterotypic synonym:
Dendrobium tortile Lindl. var. roseum Sander
, Sander’s Orch. Guide : 76, 1901. Type :— MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District , without collector s.n. (not located)
.

Specimens examined:—
KAYIN . Thaungyin Valley :
Bogg 13541
( K ). TENASSERIM. Parish 17 (not located), fide Parish (1883: 192)
.
MON . Mawlamyine District : type
.
TANINTHARYI . Dawei District :
Apr 1901
,
Mokim 570
( AMES , P ); Myeik District : type
.
Distribution:— Northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and Peninsular Malaysia .
